programmes.show_description: Beth tries to protect her family as the rumour mill in town goes wild; more victims are linked to Tom and Beth is terrified she may have married a murderer.
Judge Rinder rules the courtroom, but now the respected barrister with a background in criminal defence is stepping out from behind the bench to take on real-life cases.
No programming information is scheduled at this time due to transmitter maintenance or normal station downtime.
No programming information is scheduled at this time due to transmitter maintenance or normal station downtime.
A local dance ends in disaster when a young girl is involved in a hit and run. When the prime suspect turns out to be the son of a notable local, the heat is on Miller.
Martha visits Grey House with her husband, Tom; Sam and Cassie realize they still have more to learn about each other; Donovan's relationship gets complicated.
The Millau Viaduct is the world's tallest bridge and spans the valley of the River Tarn in southern France. Find out more about this marvel of modern engineering.
The contestants design sportswear.
Jeremy Wade takes on Africa's wild Zambezi River to find an unknown predator dragging fishermen to their deaths. Locals speak of 'the Mazunda' - a child-swallowing creature.
Presenter Peter Andre and the team visit Rochdale, Greater Manchester, to put together an Africa-inspired makeover for charity worker and volunteer Pam Semp.
Younger finds on a tramp a business card from an insurance agent who was shot dead on his doorstep and wonders if he has anything to do with a murder.
Brian Dowling and his design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost.
Alex works with the owners of a loss-making business with low occupancy rates and a number of negative reviews because the family running it cannot agree on a solution.
Ray's burial causes concern. Vinny fears for his love life. Kim orders Graham to leave.
Bernie tells Kit about Mal's stalking; Shona mislays her wedding ring; Ben takes Tim and Steve on an outing; Christina and Adam cause headaches for George.
A prison van crashes, forcing its occupants to confront a few demons; Alun and Ken stumble across some ill-gotten gains; and Weatherill gets a surprise opportunity.
Detective drama series. Wycliffe and the team are baffled when a known petty criminal turns killer. Kelsey receives some bad news.
Detective drama series. Wycliffe has some strong words for Kersey when a case of extortion is put in jeopardy.
Police drama series set in a 1960s Yorkshire village. An unusual robbery puts the locals in peril and Peggy's new enterprise proves problematic for Ventress.
After learning the mystery hitman shot the wrong woman, Holly and her team race to identify the real target before she is killed.
Christina urges George not to relinquish his inheritance; Jodie gives her right arm to help the Platts; Kit learns that Mal has been seriously injured; Bernie is arrested.
Bear spirals over his grief. Arthur pushes Laurel too far. Can Cain stop Sarah being a Dingle?
After another prostitute is slain, Fitz believes that David Harvey's wife Maggie is the killer, in spite of vehement protesting by the police and his brother, Father Michael.
The war reaches the sands of the Egyptian desert, while bombs fall on Manchester, and Harry introduces an explosive force into Robina's household, leaving her reeling.
Judge Rinder rules the courtroom, but now the respected barrister with a background in criminal defence is stepping out from behind the bench to take on real-life cases.

A prisoner is busted out of the cells. Debbie starts behaving suspiciously. Rob is devastated when a local boy avenges the death of his beloved dog.
Martha comes across the original town charter for Middleton, and while going over it, she learns that it holds some clues that could become valuable.
The AT&T Stadium in Texas, home to the Dallas Cowboys, can house over 100,000 fans. How was this engineering feat built?
The designers that have made it to the semi finals compete with menswear.
Jeremy Wade heads to the rivers of India's Himalayan region to investigate a type of dangerous catfish, but locals reveal it is sacred and he will be cursed if it is touched.
Sheila Swan from Blackpool gets a surprise home makeover from Linda Barker and the team.
Police drama series set in a 1960s Yorkshire village. An unusual robbery puts the locals in peril and Peggy's new enterprise proves problematic for Ventress.
Emma seeks a fresh start, Mike & Anna downsize, and Michael Fry grills the Housing Minister on the questions his generation needs answered.
A man's B&B struggles due to its strict set of rules and the fact the owner has largely ignored the Internet age
Bear spirals over his grief. Arthur pushes Laurel too far. Can Cain stop Sarah being a Dingle?
Christina urges George not to relinquish his inheritance; Jodie gives her right arm to help the Platts; Kit learns that Mal has been seriously injured; Bernie is arrested.
Nostalgic drama series. Ormerod and Weatherill lay Caroline's memory to rest; Mr Rose tries a change of image; and Lucy Klein oversteps the mark with Dr Goodwin.
Drama series about a Cornwall police detective. Wycliffe and the team find themselves dealing with more than a missing persons case when a lone yachtswoman disappears.
A dark family secret comes to light when a girl deliberately runs over a woman on a pedestrian crossing, and the result of an internal inquiry board is revealed.
Nostalgic police drama. Mason thwarts a gang of robbers, but how far will the crooks go to finish the job? Dawn's birthday party goes off with an unexpected bang.
When a crew member is found dead on board the Trident nuclear submarine, HMS VIGIL, the Scottish Police are called on to investigate. The catch? The UKs nuclear deterrent must remain unbroken,
Bernie protests her innocence to the police; George's livelihood comes under serious threat; Bethany helps Shona to recapture the romance; Cassie plots a surprise for Steve.
A warning at work for Jacob. Bear needs help. Arthur is panicked.
Detective Superintendent Jane Tennison finds her private and professional life in tatters when a series of murders lead to her old adversary, George Marlow.
